title: Alexandria on the Indus
text:
Alexandria on the Indus (, likely modern <a href="Uch">Uch</a>, <a href="Pakistan">Pakistan</a>) was a city founded by <a href="Alexander%20the%20Great">Alexander the Great</a> at the junction of the <a href="Indus">Indus</a> and the <a href="Panjnad%20River">Acesines river</a>. <a href="Arrian">Arrian</a> tells that colonists, mainly <a href="Thracian">Thracian</a> veterans and natives, were settled there. 
The <a href="satrap">satrap</a> of the west bank of the <a href="Indus%20river">Indus</a>, <a href="Philip%20%28son%20of%20Machatas%29">Philip, son of Machatas</a>, was put in charge of building the <a href="Towns%20of%20ancient%20Greece%23Katoikia">city</a>:
Today, the remains of the <a href="Hellenistic">Greek</a> town are thought to be inside the <a href="citadel">citadel</a> mound, although significant damage to the <a href="Tell%20%28archaeology%29">mound</a> resulted from a shift in the river. A <a href="UNESCO">UNESCO</a> listing applies to the site.
